thread.title: Sen. Bob Casey will oppose Trump Supreme Court nominee Gorsuch

author: Jonathan Tamari
title: Sen. Bob Casey will oppose Trump Supreme Court nominee Gorsuch

persons.name: jonathan tamari washington bureau  jonathan tamari

text:
Sen. Bob Casey will oppose Trump Supreme Court nominee Gorsuch Updated: March 23, 2017 — 3:45 PM EDT 286 Share Jonathan Tamari Washington Bureau 
Jonathan Tamari is the Washington correspondent. He writes about the lawmakers, politics, and policy that affect Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey. He previously covered the Eagles and the NFL. Before that he worked in Trenton, reporting on the characters and color of New Jersey state government. He lives in Washington. More by Jonathan Tamari Arr 
WASHINGTON -- Sen. Bob Casey (D., Pa.) will oppose President Trump’ 
In a call with reporters Thursday morning, Casey said he will vote against Gorsuch’s confirmation and, perhaps more critically, will also vote to sustain a Democratic filibuster 
“I don’t believe that Judge Gorsuch, his judicial approach, would ensure fairness for workers and families in Pennsylvania and indeed across the country and I will not support his nomination,” 
As for maintaining a 60-vote benchmark, Casey said that anyone hoping to obtain the influence a Supreme Court justice has “ought to be able to rack up 60 votes. 
He had long said he had major concerns over Gorsuch , but declined to take a definitive stand before this week’s confirmation hearings. After President Trump won Pennsylvania last year, Republicans had hoped to pressure Casey to support Gorsuch. They vowed to make the high court pick an issue in Casey’ 
“By opposing Judge Neil Gorsuch, Bob Casey is aligning himself with the far left instead of honoring the will of Pennsylvania voters. Pennsylvanians will remember Casey’s betrayal when they head to the polls in 2018,” said a spokesman for Republicans’ national Senate campaign arm said after Casey’ 
Casey, long known as a mild-mannered moderate, has in recent months taken to strident opposition to Trump 
Fellow Pennsylvania Sen. Pat Toomey, a Republican, has said he is “absolutely a ‘yes’ vote” for Gorsuch , barring any shocking revelations.
